questions.question_text_1: Select the correct statement about peripherals in a computer.
question_texts: Select the correct statement about peripherals in a computer.

options.option_text: CPU reads the values from the peripherals by reading the value at the memoryaddress mapped to them.
CPU has separate instructions for performing read and write from aperipheral.
CPU cannot read the values from the peripherals
There is a standard and fixed memory mappings for each input device.

questions.question_text_1: Identify the option that arranges the following memory types in typical descending order of size (from largest to smallest).
question_texts: Identify the option that arranges the following memory types in typical descending order of size (from largest to smallest).

options.option_text: Main Memory (RAM), Secondary Memory (Hard Drive), Cache Memory,Registers
Main Memory (RAM), Secondary Memory (Hard Drive), Registers, CacheMemory
Secondary Memory (Hard Drive), Main Memory (RAM), Cache Memory,Registers
Secondary Memory (Hard Drive), Registers, Main Memory (RAM), CacheMemory

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following best describes the C programming language?
question_texts: Which of the following best describes the C programming language?

questions.question_text_1:
Consider the computations given below using the generalized memory model. 
1. M[0] ← x 
2. M[1] ← y 
3. M[2] ← M[0] * M[0] 
4. M[3] ← M[1] * M[1] 
5. M[4] ← 2 * M[0] * M[1] 
6. M[5] ← M[2] + M[4] 
7. M[6] ← M[3] - M[4] 
8. M[6] ← M[5] + M[6] 
What is the value of M[6] at the end of the execution?
question_texts:
Consider the computations given below using the generalized memory model. 
1. M[0] ← x 
2. M[1] ← y 
3. M[2] ← M[0] * M[0] 
4. M[3] ← M[1] * M[1] 
5. M[4] ← 2 * M[0] * M[1] 
6. M[5] ← M[2] + M[4] 
7. M[6] ← M[3] - M[4] 
8. M[6] ← M[5] + M[6] 
What is the value of M[6] at the end of the execution?

questions.question_text_1: A CPU architecture features an instruction set with 30 unique instructions. Each instruction consistently uses three operands. Every operand needs to address any of 256 distinct general-purpose registers. What is the minimum number of bits necessary to encode one such instruction?
question_texts: A CPU architecture features an instruction set with 30 unique instructions. Each instruction consistently uses three operands. Every operand needs to address any of 256 distinct general-purpose registers. What is the minimum number of bits necessary to encode one such instruction?
